chunks.en: What electronic trash is 16e?

chunks.en: 800nit 60hz low screen dimming, single camera, magsafe removed, no ultra-wideband, even uwb is removed (airtag cannot be used), A18 is still further cut down, using the C1 chip for testing (and no Qualcomm tax), comparing with devices from 4-5 years ago (iphone11 12), to release such a product in 2025, selling for 4499, I don't know what Apple is thinking. Truly only Apple can do.
The blessing of Apple fans

I think this time is very impressive, from the naming to the pricing, and the strategy, are very strong, much smarter than before. First, this machine is considered a 16 series, so for some people, they buy new and not old, what they are buying is 16, although it is 16E, it is also a 16 series, satisfying the comparison mentality, many people don't buy mini, basically they all like big. Second, this pricing gives distributors a lot of room, and follows the national subsidy policy, from a risk perspective, it is very good.
@bk201 Then please withdraw from the WTO first
We Apple should also have our own Nova11ğŸ¤£
@gogozs Why give the bad ones to parents?
Apple's official account specifically marked participating in national subsidies, with an actual selling price of 3999ğŸ˜‚
@laikick #8 Quoting without mentioning the source?
Good signal, C1 signal is awesome. Bad signal, Huawei base station is trash.
@laikick #8 'This is a good thing', matches the avatar
@bk201 Trump economicsğŸ˜‚
The Qualcomm tax that OP mentioned cannot be avoided, it's a patent licensing fee.
I love to hear the scolding
Locked for 899 in 2 years
Very good, those more useless things like SE1-3 can be sold, SE4 doesn't lack a market even more, 8G of memory and there's a shutter button ğŸ˜‚
Although 16e is trash, the storage is gold.
@bk201 National subsidy is a 'consumption subsidy introduced by the state', not a 'domestic subsidy'. Apple pays so much tax in China every year, it's normal to participate in national subsidies.

@bk201 Apple pays much more taxes in the country than domestic companies, not to mention that Apple can't get huge subsidies like Huawei. If you really want to revitalize domestic consumption, it's never been about our little sesame seeds. It really depends on whether the red aristocracy and mysterious rich people are willing to return to China for consumption, that's the core.
@bk201 Just force foreign brands to be removed from the shelves, wouldn't that be enough?

chunks.en: @tunggt I'm used to picking up used ones on eBay. I picked up an SE3 for $130 a couple of years ago for my mom, which is pretty good. I just don't know if it's easy to modify the SIM card on this machine. If I don't have to touch the motherboard, that's fine. I'll try to pick up an XR for $199 to replace my dad's too. This kind of machine is suitable for buying for the elderly, the things that are cut are not needed by the elderly, which is very good. I really don't trust buying domestic Android.
@tunggt What are you thinking? Consumption of course relies on the "masses". Billionaires buying private jets is not as good as the "masses" each having a 1000 yuan Redmi phone.
